page.title: 17 RAILWAY REVIVAL
page.content: Ever since the{Great Western}and{ {Southern}lines were closed here in October 1966,there has been an effort to retain over 2 miles of the section from Launceston to Egloskerry.We enjoyed the ride along the 60 cm gauge track in an open_sided coach drawn by the{steam engine}'Lilian'.She was built in 1883 in Leeds and was rescued after being at Penryhn slate quarry in North Wales in 1964 by the present owner and railway enthusiast.He showed us the fire_box which generated heat to boil water which produced the{steam which was controlled by valves and was the driving power.Points and coupling the carriages still work as they did originally.From the{cutting,}stone had been used for the{embankment.}The track goes under the{road bridge }and the aqueduct which took water from the River Kensey to the{Town Mills.
